Q3dWiTtkohUVliMgyO4qXw.text: After learning that Bang Bang Burgers have a second location at South End last night, I managed to drag my husband and son to this joint tonight.  First of all, I love the casual decor (mix of wood & industrial).  Although this is a smallish restaurant, it has a spacious style...thanks to its high ceilings.  I definitely prefer the overall vibe here over the one at their original location.  However, it's basically the same menu as Bang Bang Burgers.  I heard that this location used to serve up Sliders, but they seemed to have discontinued them.  No matter, no complaints here.  I tried the "K-Pop Burgers" this time (last time, I tried their signature Bang Bang Burgers...which was the Bomb!)...and it did not disappoint.  Who knew Kimchee would go so well with a Burger??  I also tried the Sweet Potato Fries (instead of the standard Fries or the Onion Rings) this time...and that also did not disappoint.  My husband (Mushroom & Swiss Burger) and son (Cowboy Burger ) were also very happy with their burgers and fries .  In short, this burger joint is Awesome...definitely my favorite burger spot in town!  If only they'd open even a third location closer to me??

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;K-Pop Burger&#34; &amp; Sweet Potato Fries

neFdBGsTPuXLfjwO97j8UA.text: Really great burgers!! I got the burger bowl (a salad with burger on top), it was delicious!

bn4d8AgriPznxQjtwF_-0A.text: My boyfriend and I placed a pick up order and our attendant was super friendly and the food was ready in 15 minutes! Cute spot in southend, but burger bowls could include some other additions for a more diverse and hardy meal. My boyfriend enjoyed the grilled chicken sandwich and overall we were satisfied!

lhjVU0asaWQ1S6CFhPWT9A.text: I was surprised how good these burgers were! I had special French onion burger and my husband had one with guacamole! Both delicious. Nice they have vegetables as side dish but wish there was an option to get salad as a side. Beer was ice cold, service great and location cool. Will be back!

xIHqaOwUp7K4GEk3N9Eoug.text: We had amazing service here on a Friday night. The staff was amazing and courteous. Will definitely be returning. The food was amazing from the fresh buns to the homemade pickles. The food options were abundant. There were healthy options as well as just a burger and fries. Awesome experience.  Great job!!!

2g5ubT25HePU9mgoRprjjw.text: I was really, really excited to try Bang Bang Bites. Bang Bang Burgers is one of the best spots in town, so I knew the bite sized option had to be equally as good, if not better.   Unfortunately, I came away disappointed. Three sliders, fries and a drink were close to $18. The burgers themselves weren't nearly as juicy as the ones I have eaten at Bang Bang Burgers.   Overall, glad I tried it, but probably won't make my way back anytime soon...

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

kX0chrJBQVNadTf3ik76SA.text: Honestly, I had high hopes for bang bang bites Since bang bang burgers is my favorite burger place in Charlotte. I have to say that I was very disappointed. It is overpriced for what you get. I ordered the fried mac & cheese in the bacon cheddar sliders. The fried mac & cheese was pretty good. The bacon cheddar was a joke. It was tiny with melted shredded cheese. The patties were very small and did not fill the buns. My fries tasted like they were cooked 10 minutes before I ordered. I've never had that problem at the original bang bang. I don't think that we will be going back unless something changes regarding the menu at bang bang bites. I do appreciate the concept and that they're giving the opportunity for people to try different burger toppings. We will stick with bang bang burgers in the future.

xz_5EmiYR48uQ_V8hEu97Q.text: Best burgers in Charlotte. Great date night spot for quick eats before heading out for drinks.

fDJfrBeaVmkleC0eZwKYEw.text: I absolutely loved this place. I have heard nothing but good things about the place on 7th street so I figured I'd give the bites place a try. The young man that took our order was very thorough on the process to order and gave us his opinion on any questions we had. The burgers had tons of flavor and cooked to perfection. The staff was friendly and the order came out in a reasonable amount of time. I will definitely be back.

XbRJXcAChTNXgh--aSdJhQ.text: Me and my husband went here last night for dinner, I got the traditional bang bang burger and he got the daily special. The burgers itself is below average in my opinion, the meat is dry and thin, and much topping neither. the food is cold when we got them. Great thing is the customer service and it's not too crowded here, that's why the place is 3 star to me.

hbQfMQMNLVZNq6E0Tdv8yQ.text: Great place. Had the keto burger over salad. Their lemon olive oil dressing was to die for. Everything was very fresh. My only comment to the owner is to add cheese to the burger on the meal. It would have put it over the top.

uInaviSiHAA-qlEsMgImBg.text: This place is amazing!! I've came here a few times already and each time they never disappoint. The staff is so helpful, and the food is just so AMAZING and mouth watering! I forgot to take a pic before taking a bite, which says a lot!

UQ8xsuadEJvakxjzJSkTRg.text: I went to bang bang bites and was disappointed. The staff was super friendly, the space was great, but the parking lot was tiny so keep that in mind. As for the food, I ordered 3 sliders: siracha, k-pop, and the pimento. They were ok, but at $15 for three and chips, the price was steep and I still felt hungry when I left. I did not get asked how I wanted my sliders cooked and they were super well done (boo!). The chips were average at best.  I heard this morning Joe is going back to his original model of no sliders. Good man to put your ego aside and kudos for trying something different and listening to the feedback of your customers.  I hope this choice is successful for you! Would possibly come back at some point.

dB8HQfOuN8FT1jxRKSDcTw.text: First time visiting Charolette North Carolina and we weren't sure what type of food we wanted after the longest day of travel. I happened upon Bang Bang South End and saw the great reviews! Sold. How can you mess up a burger? We venture over and are immediately pleased with the aesthetics. It's one of those places where you order first. Definitely take their recommendations! Cowboy Burger, SUPERB! The bun, the meat, the fries...perfection. Wife had the Siracha burger and was blown away. She judges a place by how good their ranch is. It was bomb. Go, go now! You'll be really happy.

gDpre1Np8QGRYdVO5dF16Q.text: This place is AMAZING!!! I came here and got the black bean burger, and sweet potato fries with a maple side sauce!!! The fries were made perfectly crisp and the sauce had an incredible tangy sweet note! The burger was made to perfection and topped with a delicious layer of guacamole! They have one of those cool computer pop machines, a great reward system and excellent PERSONABLE customer service!! Southern hospitality at its best!!! Ill be here for lunch moving forward!!! Cool atmosphere ... rustic-urban feel! Bon appetite!! Excuse the photo I had already started eating! Ha!

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

V2ETfX7yH7gl4_lnOAPhhw.text: I had the bang bang cheeseburger medium rare, and it was excellent. It had crisp lettuce, good tomato, and the best pickles I've ever had on a burger.

HnlaqARDbkTkWTjwSMCaXQ.text: I was excited about Bang Bang Burgers before their Elizabeth location ever even opened and have loved them since. When I lived in Chantilly I visited them all of the time, then moved away, and before I knew it I hadn't been in a couple of years. Now I live within walking distance of their new(ish) Southend location between Zeppelin and Common Market, so I had to visit! You guys...... I liked their first location a lot, but this new one is BEAUTIFUL!!! It's my new go-to spot for low carb bunless burgers now :)

Wc_5qKrV7GUR95eCTty8Uw.text: Overall this place is good but not the best burger I've had. What I like is the service was super friendly and they buns are done local from a bakery. Overall seems like a lot is made from scratch and sourced in Charlotte which is awesome. I got the single pimento burger. The burger itself was really good. But the bun was too much bread for the single, the fried pickles were all breading (took them off), the pimento cheese was not that great I actually took half of it off too. It was not served with any lettuce or toppings like most places. The dipping sauces were also off almost they all had too much mayo which almost tasted low fat. We tried ranch and bang bang, neither were that great. Fries were fresh and great! Bbq chips were good but since they make in batches some were not crispy from sitting. On a side note the heat was out and freezing but they fixed while there and it got better but it was ice cold at first. They did apologize and acknowledge the issue. If they nail down the test the burgers will be 5 stars

bZAby-shhYJ7PIm5aKU6nw.text: One word - WOW. Ok more than one word - omg these burgers are sooo good! I ordered the cowboy which was one of their popular options and is basically a BBQ bacon cheeseburger without LTO. As I was waiting for our food I mentioned to hubby that maybe I should've added them on, but I'm glad I didn't because I think it made the flavor of the burger come through that much more, and what a flavor it was. Even the bun was good. They serve their sauces on the side which is cool so you can add as little or as much as you'd like. When the burger first came, it seemed kinda tiny but I felt satisfied. Hubby ordered the hangover which he loved and I had a bite of and liked too. Even he gave it a 5 which is very impressive considering he doesn't hand them out easily. The fries weren't the best I've had for some reason, but I still ate them all because I love my fries haha. DEFINITELY coming back again and glad I signed up for the rewards program.

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cowboy burger. Yum!
Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cowboy burger - MMM

UnOFnI2e8V5rHOlOsbiXGg.text: Awesome!!!!! Great food fast service !!!!! One of the best burgers around!!!! Wife had the salmon salad and it was equally as good!!! We will be back !!!

Mhpp7VlWVuGDQZMksiGEiA.text: This place lives up to the hype. I was going through a healthy phase when we went a few weeks ago, so opted for the beef burger bowl. It was so satisfying. For Whole 30 / Paleo folks out there, I think the bowl minus the bacon is compliant.

DJ7pdRkAb3Dl8y90JHSwsw.text: My biggest compliment was how well everything stayed together. I even got the sloppy joe burger and didn't feel like a caveman eating it. The bun was kinda dry but it suited the burger. The patty itself was flavorful but I'm dropping a star because, for $12, I barely tasted the toppings. It was all good and I have no real complaints but it didn't blow me away.

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sloppy joe burger
Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Weekly special

WUL8H-FLzLZR1fP9qf7IBA.text: I am a huge fan of bang bang burgers in Elizabeth. I was very excited for the south end location to open. I tried it when they were serving sliders and I was satisfied with the food per price but preferred the regular burgers. Happy they changed to the original as they're the best burgers in town!  Inside is clean and both times I've been I have found parking and seating. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  My favorite is the bang bang burger. The sauce is amazing and I always order extra to dip my fries in. Their meat is high quality and their pickles are wonderful, I've thought about ordering a side of pickles before! The fries are tasty and I loved the sweet potato chips- they were crisp and lightly salted.

YFBhuy_jy9IiIJXHBRVcJQ.text: Yummy place!  I was pleasantly surprised by my first visit--the food was yummy and the staff was delightful.  The cashier was very nice, I wish I would've gotten her name.  My burger was basic (as I like it) and the price was fair.  And it's Halal!

hKPSsSoJWnZP2d9POb6-sw.text: Superb. I work in South End and used to live in Elizabeth, so I was pumped when I heard a new Bang Bang was coming to the area.  I ordered the Pimento Burger with fries to go. The burger was a perfect medium rare. Enough juice left to be messy, but not enough to run down to your elbows. Fries were delicious.   They have a cool atmosphere in there as well. A couple TVs were tuned in to the Masters. Plenty of seating, but I imagine it gets crowded when they get busier.

TBnT1t_arhxT9AnZLcTLTg.text: I wanted to take time to re-write a well deserved review for this place:   1. I have always enjoyed the food here. It is one of the best burger places in Southend and well worth every penny! The burgers are not only delicious, but very healthy. Everyone SHOULD be eating grass-fed beef so when I saw they offered this, I was instantly a fan.   2. I can't remember his name but every time I come in, there is a guy that usually helps take my order. He is super nice, always recognizes me, and we end up having a great conversation. I always enjoy seeing him in there.   3. The one bad experience I had, which had NOTHING to do with the food but instead with the service (I believe they forgot we were on hold when we tried to order take out) was so nicely resolved. Just the fact that Joe, the owner/operator was nice enough to write a long apology went such a long way. Thank you for doing that. I was in the service industry for a very long time and I understand mistakes happen, but the fact that he took time to write back meant everything. We look forward to coming back a million more times... thanks Joe!

e7VveBLbVtKr5RuXp76vMg.text: We really do love this place. The food is delicious. The buns are so tasty. We have been to both locations and for some reason this location has very slow service. We don't come to this location when we are limited for time.

llf1fxiRmmvCjzjShZzcGg.text: Fun environment; tasty food! We had the special (fried mozzarella & sun dried tomato aioli burger) & tried the cheeseburger egg roll (YUM!!!). Will definitely come back :)

Qip6nHc5jFl6w_6d0wvHmQ.text: Another fantastic local find here in Charlotte! Debbie Wassil Schmoekel got the Mushroom Swiss Burger and I got the TNT Burger (with fresh jalapenos & pepper jack cheese) both bunless of course and some excellent fresh broccoli as our sides. We highly recommend this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. I got the TNT Burger bunless with a side of fresh broccoli. Deeeeeliciousss!!!!

Vg3hRqbtTQC0CN860cv_bQ.text: Extremely over priced for a simple patty and huge bun. You would be better off grabbing 6 cheeseburgers from McDonald's for the same price and be more satisfied. The chips however were very nice. Fresh and crispy! But for $10 for a single burger with nothing on it but bacon and cheese. Then you have to pay 4 dollars extra for chips and a drink. Take your money elsewhere if you are looking for a filling meal!

YDth0qgKNOcYU4LA8jUWKQ.text: This place is great went out to have a burger with friend because I was hungry staff nice great taste and flavor burger

OYOg42-qvT7HW8mnUMoseg.text: Had a really good meal tonight and amazing customer service! The workers who took my order/brought my food made my first experience here great. Definitely will be returning

h-ZTcPZc-wPIjlSKr32t6g.text: Absolute "go-to"  spot  for fast casual burgers. Open and airy atmosphere. All components of burgers and fries are fresh. Comical staff that enjoys what they do. Iffy on paid value for price. Hard to justify $10+ for the smaller burger and patties.   BUT, the taste will bring me and my guests back!   Recommend asking for Bang Bang sauce.

HdzBv8MaxmXToB7r6zeVpA.text: I'm sold. I always get the special and I've never been disappointed. Best burgers in Charlotte. Worth every penny. I've never had the double pattie burger because the single is enough.  My only suggestion is to work on the fries. I'm not a fan of the limp soggie "hand cut" fry.  These burgers with McDonald's fries would be the ultimate.

H1rgPp0E9D23WTfureZU5w.text: Definitely worth the visit for a good quality burger! My go to burger is the pimento burger, I'm a big fan of pimento cheese and Bang Bang doesn't disappoint. Get your burger cooked medium, fa sho! The patty is delicious and the bun is toasted and absolutely the perfect combo. I've only gone to Bang Bang for lunch and the service is always good, no matter how busy.

_kqDe1xTVD-4Ou6T3Ykngg.text: Went to Bang Bang for lunch. Ordered the Bang Bang Burger with a few adaptations. The burger was juicy and cooked to perfection. The natural cut fries were hot and crispy. Service was great. The young man that took our order regularly checked on us and was very helpful. Parking was a little difficult due to Common Market construction.

jfqFCjTKmZxp30I66sTJjQ.text: Would love to be able to try the new location. We've attempted twice and both times had note on door saying closing early tonight (tonight it was 35 Min before stated closing). Hope they keep more consistent hours!

eMFxrDnXLXmPqSqPLGdlug.text: Hands down my favorite burger spot!  Excellent and inventive menu choices.  Quality ingredients and the option on healthy sides.  Absolutely try the weekly special.  No matter how crazy the combination sounds, trust me they work every time!  Today I had the elvis burger.  Follow them on Facebook.  Every Friday they post a video of the preparation of that weeks special (changes on Friday) so you can see exactly whats goes in the creation.  The short rib La Freida hamburger patty is indescribably delicious and flame grill cooked to order.  No cooked to death meat here, unless you like it that way.  ;)

mYW5j0WLAfmuYQ-i70uJGg.text: Been a huge fan of the Bang Bang on 7th since it opened, but when my husband and I moved to South End two years ago, our visits became less frequent.  I am a firm believer that they serve the best burgers in town, so the loss of easy access to that location was pretty disappointing.  When I heard about the new location I was skeptical about the bites concept, but was thrilled that they reworked it and went back to what they do better than anyone else in the city! We visited finally this weekend and I was more than satisfied that the quality is spot on, and I even like the thicker cut sweet potato fries at this location even better than the hand cut ones at the original.    I always get the original bang bang burger, because it's so classic, but I have gotten rave reviews of their other offerings from friends and family I have taken with me over the years.  The buns are perfect in every way, the ground beef is super high quality, and the bang bang sauce is so tasty I occasionally dip my fries in it!   True parking isn't amazing but it's a teeny walk from the East Blvd light rail stop, and a block from the rail trail.  If you have never been to the original, you owe it to yourself to visit!

hkBMITq36SBkzf43hfh8Jg.text: Ventured here with friends when the wait at Superica was too long. Didn't really know what to expect, but when we walked in on a Sunday afternoon it wasn't too busy. I ordered the Cowboy double with the black bean patties and fries. They are served on boards with whatever your sauce is on the side. Presentation was perfect! Flavor was strong, but the black bean patties fell apart easily which made this a little messy. The mess was worth it and overall it was tasty. A couple of my friends got the Pimento burger and said it too was delicious, just heavy. I would definitely come here again, probably for lunch instead of dinner.

-n8jmPMCTawc2wF3ART6UQ.text: Holy moly I'm obsessed with this place!! Absolutely my new "go to" when I am craving a burger. Service is great and the staff is super friendly. They have plenty of inviting seating that actually makes you want to sit and eat your burger instead of taking it to go. There is a huge TV in the middle as well. There are canned beers to purchase to wash down the tastiness.   My husband got the Cowboy burger with fries and I got the black bean burger with brussels. The portions are just right and everything tasted delicious! It leaves you completely satisfied instead of that "I over ate" feeling.

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black Bean Burger with Brussels Sprouts

pQ2W0ILkuwvcEZm20K6HUw.text: I had been looking forward to this opening since the Charlotte Agenda first wrote about it. I've been to Bang Bang Burgers and love it and thought a slider option sounded awesome. We scheduled a cheat day from our diet to try it and were very disappointed.   We got 3 slicers each: Pimiento, Sriracha, Fried Mac and Cheese, K-Pop, Blue and Bacon Jam, and Crispy Chicken. There were many problems, the biggest of which was that the meat was dry, overcooked, and flavorless. We asked for them medium rare and they came out medium well. The patties are also incredibly tiny and don't come close to filling the bun. The best ones were the ones that had enough sauce to cover up the bad tasting burger -- the Blue and Bacon Jam, the Pimento, and the K-Pop. The Crispy Chicken was by far the best. The chicken was delicious unlike the beef. The other two were so dry they were almost inedible. We got BBQ and sweet potato chips as our sides. They were both pretty good, but I liked the sweet potato more.   The price for what you get isn't cheap either. Considering the size of the sliders, $15+ is quite a bit to pay (plus half of them have an upcharge).   Considering that they know how to cook a normal burger at their other restaurant, I'm really hoping they are just still working out the kinks for making sliders. If I see reviews start to change, I'd give them another chance. Otherwise I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

xOyj0nxIBFRM4Gg7fdaYGw.text: This is a cute place. Fun environment and good selection of burgers!   I ordered the single Bang Bang burger with sweet potato fries. I really enjoyed the bang sauce on my burger. It was cooked correctly and very tasty. The sweet potato fries were a win too! They come with this very yummy dipping sauce!  Service was spot on as well! Overall, an excellent experience!   If you're on the hunt for a great burger - this is your spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

0NJB4bv1egrEj9T70xNG3A.text: This is more of a fast-casual type concept where you order at the register and get a table number for them to deliver your food.  They have a nice assortment of burgers for people that like all sorts of things. I went basic and got the Bang Bang Burger. All of the ingredients were fresh and the pickles nice and crisp (not warm and soggy). I'm a big fan of sauces and dips so I tried three different ones (Bang Bang, Ranch and Pesto Mayo). The Pesto Mayo is amazing! I would buy just that for my apt and put it on chicken, grilled cheese, etc.   The Brussels sprouts were crispy but not burnt and not too salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger and Brussels Sprouts

aNeZM8hjigRIHf4vWal-vA.text: I love this place the salmon bowls and sweet potato fries are the best everyone is super friendly.

szMD1UgSUzGqZY6SK6OxBQ.text: I was seriously so excited to try this place, but it didn't live up to my expectations. However the staff was SO kind that I wanted to love it. I do give the staff a 5 Star review! My burger was so pink in the middle and it was so disappointing. I asked for a bacon cheddar ranch and didn't get any bacon (which is cmon the best part)! The guac that comes on the guac cheddar burger is good though!   The burgers do not fill the buns. I think it's a really good concept but needs some extra help. I think having a small menu is smart right now because they need to learn from some of these reviews.   The homemade chips are actually decent, BBQ flavor would be my fav! I will give it another shot but will def give it sometime before I come back...

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon cheddar ranch, guac burger

RiXk8wN_EJbO0L1VwcwT8w.text: Bang Bang is SO good. Just straight up quality burgers in an awesome atmosphere. I ordered the Burger Bowl with a beef patty with cheddar (it can also be ordered with chicken or salmon and maybe a veggie burger?) and I loved it. So filling...comes with hard boiled egg, bacon, guacamole and sweet potato chunks as well as the typical burger toppings. 10/10 would order again. The sweet potato fries were also delicious and my friend really liked her hamburger. They offer some beers by the can and have about 5 on draft and all come with a chilled mug if you prefer. All around, a solid spot the grab lunch or dinner...I will definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small but tasty beer menu
Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. For you adventurous folks...a plain hamburger with zero toppings
Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger bowl with cheddar

qKonWLqGPBK3NuzDI0jCaQ.text: I enjoyed their new location in South End and appreciate that they are open relatively late for weekday nights - 10 pm.  They have a variety of both indoor and outdoor seating.  Order at the counter and hey deliver your food to you.   I'm loving the burger bowl options - more like a salad that you can get meet on top of. I went with the salmon and it was delicious. I love the salad dressing!  And it comes with hard boiled egg, sweet potatoes, tomato and onion.  Very good and the whole thing is very filling.  Will definitely order again.  The rest of our tables food was equally delicious.  One ordered a burger and one a salmon blt.  I will say I enjoyed the regular fries better than the sweet potato fries and I'm usually the opposite.

rmQ2O_dL172_YTmjJuc5Hg.text: Great burger joint. My wife and I love their burgers. The variety of burger offerings is great. It's an Asian burger fusion. . . I think. So you have some unique burger types like the Seoul with kimchi and Bulgagi beef sauce or more  traditional burgers like the hangover with the egg and potato bacon hash (my personal favorite) or more southern like the pimento burger with pimento cheese and fried pickles.  They also have healthy-ish choices like the burger bowl (like a burger salad) or the quinoa bean burger. Their chips and fries are good. We also always get the cheeseburger egg roll. It is super tasty. I wish the egg roll was bigger. And 3 dollars for the size seems a little pricey, but if you come you have to get one.  We also like the staff. They are friendly and helpful. Refills are self serve and I am ok with that. It's family friendly and it's a good place to just grab a burger and beer with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. The pimento burger with fries
Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

7XT25L2IoE0o-hqzk2kJ2Q.text: Loving this new location and I'm very glad they decided to offer the full menu, not just "bites". My husband and I were looking for something in the South End area that was on the faster side, but still decent for you and good food. I ordered their veggie burger and a side of broccoli (there is an up-charge for this, but I was trying to be healthy and not get fries). My husband got one of the burgers (sorry, I forget), and upgraded to the side of brussel sprouts (also attempting to be healthy, but these were actually cooked in butter, so not so much haha).   The veggie burger is one of my favorites around! It's black bean based and stays together better than most veggie burgers. It does squish out a little while eating, but not to the point of a huge mess. Everything that comes on it is excellent, but you could also get any burger with that patty if you wanted. The broccoli was also steamed to a bright green.. not over cooked or mushy at all.  Can't wait to come back!

NbgNF3KcZpsR-HGSFikoUw.text: After seeing the weekly special on Facebook I couldn't help but stop in. I've been to the other location and loved it so I was definitely looking forward to this location as well.  Both my husband and I ordered the Tomatillo Guacamole Burger. I genuinely hope they add this to the regular menu because it was absolutely delicious! Grilled onion, jalapeno, and tomatillo, chopped and then mixed with avocado, cilantro, and lime juice...all over a beef patty with chorizo, pepper jack cheese, and chipotle mayo. I'm still dreaming about this burger!  We had great service and our food arrived fast since we made sure to visit after the lunch rush. I always suggest Bang Bang to friends who are looking for a great place to eat in Charlotte. Looking forward to visiting again!

XuruI9XzMiIXvGOaDgVOGA.text: We stopped by for dinner. The burgers were very tasty, but a little on the thinner side. I had the mushroom / Swiss, which was delicious. My husband has the burger bowl and raved about it. The fries were a tad greasy. Service was friendly and atmosphere was cool.  I'd stop by again if I was nearby but wouldn't go out of my way to this place.

MpTV0xVMhe7kG30a2ppEGA.text: My son wanted to come here for his 18th birthday.  He saw the episode on Food Network.  We were not disappointed.  The customer service was excellent.  Kayla took our order and was very knowledgable about the food and beers. We definitely will be back.  To the gentleman in the back cooking y'all did great job.  My son had the Sriracha burger and cheeseburger rolls.  I had the weekly special Grilled bologna and cream cheese burger w/fried egg (da bomb)!  Thank you!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bang Bang Burgers South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

6LkmEVeFpiHMbfOu2o0zxw.text: First time trying this place and got the Sriracha burger and chicken club to go. The burger good, not quite as spicy as expected but it had a delicious kick. My Wife said her chicken was the juiciest and most flavorful she's ever had. Price is the only downside, but if you want a cheap burger, there's always cookout.

gfnTWKFURaj99SluPKdJzg.text: Great burger and fries. Excellent service too.  I had the bang bang burger with crispy fries and an IPA. 9bkRGR0pBpBTkFy-zmZJyw.text: This.  Place.  Is.  Awesome.    Food:  Delicious.  Perfect. Everything you would want in a burger.  You are doing yourself a wrong if you are in the area and do not go here for your burger.    Drinks:  They have a few beers on tap and sodas.   Staff:  Super friendly with great personalities.  The guy taking the orders had great knowledge of the menu, a welcome relief to someone who is not familiar with their various sauces, etc.  Atmosphere:  They have lovely outdoor tiered seating as well as moderate indoor seating.  It looks pretty new.  It has a trendy, industrial feel to it.  The place is not huge and you WILL be eating close to strangers, so if that bothers you, look elsewhere, especially if you will be dining at peak times.  Personal sidenote:  [keep reading] I will preface it by saying that we were there on a Saturday night at dinner time, so it was, expectantly, super busy.  You order/pay up front, similar to a fast food joint; I do not mind standing in an efficiently-run line, but this was not that sort of line.  I feel like I stood in the same place for ten minutes.  The whole line, probably seven people, took about twenty minutes prior to being able to place our order.  They had two registers, but no way to access the second one without weaving your way through the first one, as well as they only had one person on the registers.  Another person was going down the line taking any beer orders, but that did not help the line move any faster.  When the guy taking my order said it would still be another 20-25 minutes after I placed my order to get my food, I was bummed.  I told the guy I happened to be running late for an event I was attending, which was by no fault of anyone but my own.  I was surprised when the food came out about five minutes later and when I looked over to the order-taking guy in surprise, and he gave me a thumbs up, even while continuing to take other folks' orders.  Obviously he heard the hangry timely-challenged desperation in my voice and satiated that monster and thus allowing me to almost get to my event on time.  I really appreciated that!  I hope to visit them again the next time I am in town and will make sure to give myself plenty of time to enjoy it!  Tip:  Go here!

mF99httsfy23kiW6E32W5w.text: I was down in South End taking a yoga class and was looking for something fun to try. This place is AWESOME. The staff was so friendly and attentive. It's a fast casual set-up, so you'll order at the counter, take a number, and wait for your food to be served. They have a huge selection of cans of craft beers and about 5 local option on draft. My sister loved that they do "burger bowls", so if you're keeping it a little healthier it's no big deal! Any of their burgers can be made a single or double.  Normally I would opt for something healthier, but their burger special looked too good to pass up: The Elvis. Beef burger with munster cheese, tempura banana, banana peppers, bacon, and a peanut butter sauce on a buttery roll. HEAVEN TO ME. It was sweet, salty, vinegary, and meaty. I should've made it a double ;) I had broccoli for a side to balance it out (even if only slightly!) and it was delicious. Our main order taker even gave us some chips so that we could try them fresh out of the frier. So warm and salty. I will absolutely be back.

Qs2G2EnwvaZtCybCaxkRdQ.text: Finally got around to checking the "new guy" in Southend... actually there are a lot of "new guys" and I'm falling behind very fast.  I believe the "bites" concept has changed so they are offering full burgers here.  They pretty much went "all in" with the restaurant decor.  From the ceiling fans that look like farm windmills, to the cattle fence that directs you to the registers, there's definitely no shortage of theme here.  It is definitely an interesting space with the wood and industrial chairs.  There's even a little upstairs "nook" with about two tables... maybe for private parties or large groups?  The group would be limited though.... from what I saw, there was a couple up there enjoying their privacy and lift view of the restaurant.  Staff was super friendly and patient as we perused the menu.  It looks like they do a good bit of take out/to go orders as well for the neighborhood.  I had the mushroom and Swiss burger and it came with a generous side of mustard.  The fries were presented in a mini frying basket and the whole thing presented on a wooden tray with handle.  You order at the register and the servers will give you a number to find you in the dining room.    Also ordered an egg roll snack that I split with my friend.  It comes piping hot and split into two with the signature bang bang sauce.  My friends burger had fresh jalapenos on it (sriracha burger) so if you enjoy major heat, I'd recommend that one.  There are two coke machines in the back... looks like they are more compact and a little more user friendly from the "version 1" coke machines I'm used to seeing everywhere.  Overall it was a good dining experience.  I'm a fan of the large squirt bottles of ketchup on each table and rolls of paper towels.  There's a nice porch/deck area, however it was raining that day we visited.  Probably my one ding is parking... I guess they share parking with next door The Zepplin so it was a rainy weekday night and the lot was full.... I can't imagine this place on the weekends.  There is street parking but if you are coming in from a different neighborhood, be prepared to walk if the lot is full.  And with all the stuff coming into Tremont, I'm sure the parking situation will just become more challenging.

68TEPKYAY8rP1shyUKpxHw.text: Great little shop with craft beers and a good burger!    My wife and I stopped here on the way to a show - Yelp led the way!  The smell carried from the smoke was great as we approached the entrance, and walked in to no line at the counter where you order!  Domestic drafts were on special, so I grabbed a 22oz brew and a regular burger with fries.  My wife ordered her standard grilled chicken sandwich and took our number and sat down.  Our food came out hot and well presented - my burger was served gastro pub style on a wood board with the fries in a metal cup.  The patty was thinner than I expected, but someone was cooked perfectly so there was still pink inside.  It was tasty, and the fries were really good.    Really close to a 5-star review, it's a place that I would go back to if we were in the area, but not out of our way to visit.

Jyj3iVULK62Qe7mBXtbfPw.text: Bang Bang is A-OK. I wouldn't put it at the top of the burger food chain but it's a necessary dining option amidst all of the breweries and slightly more trendy restaurants in South End. I do believe they've found an awesome yin to their yang with Common Market opening up next door.  I really wish I could've tried them when they were slingin' sliders but, oh well. Fingers crossed that they find a way to re-introduce them as a menu item. Bang Bang is located right next door to Zeppelin and has an outdoor patio with picnic-style tables and a fire pit. There's also plenty of inside seating.  Whether you're dining outside or in, you place your order inside at the counter. The menu is brightly-lit and available above the cashier. I have tried the guacamole, bang bang, and cowboy burgers. My personal favorite is the bang bang burger. It's a classic for a reason! I've usually gone with the regular fries as a side but have had the brussels once. The brussels need to be roasted a little longer and seasoned in order for me to enjoy them as a regular choice of side. They also offer sweet potato fries.  They have alcohol - cans of beer from the local breweries and your normal soft drink options. Once your order is placed, you get a number for your table and your food is brought out to you. Last time I was there, the staff seemed to be confused by a friend's order and took a while bringing out her side. It was handled sort of awkwardly but they did bring out the correct side after plenty of time had surpassed.  Again, not the best but still qualifies as a pretty good burger!

YVXAO1ffK2JFZxqWHr-JWg.text: We had lunch at Bang Bang Burgers in South End and enjoyed it. This place makes pretty good burgers.  This is the second location of Bang Bang Burgers although it didn't originally start that way. The business opened earlier this year, February 2018, as Bang Bang Bites. Bang Bang Bites specialized in sliders and the concept didn't last long (about a month). Customers wanted burgers and burgers are easier for the kitchen to make, so Bang Bang Bites became Bang Bang Burgers. The first Bang Bang Burgers location is in Elizabeth. This one in South End is located on the same property as the Common Market (same parking lot). There's free parking on-site as well as free parking on the street (no meters).  This is a fast-casual restaurant where you stand in line, order, pay upfront, and wait for your order to be brought to you. Fountain drinks (Coke Freestyle), tea, and water are self-serve. There are taps of beer behind the counter. The space was renovated for Bang Bang. It looks good. The interior has a modern warehouse feel to it with exposed brick and ductwork and industrial-looking windmill ceiling fans. There's plenty of seating. It consists of communal bar-height tables and smaller tables set up against a cow-spotted banquette. There's also an elevated nook in the back. Outside, there's a patio (dog-friendly, I believe) with two levels of seating including umbrella-covered picnic tables with plants for decor. Everything still looked nice and new during our visit.  When we visited, the menu featured eight burgers priced at $9.50 to $10.50 each for single-patty burgers and $12.50 to $13.50 for double-patty burgers. There was also a weekly special burger ($11.50 single, $13.50 double) which we ended up ordering. Bang Bang offers grass-fed beef, gluten-free buns, and black bean patties at additional cost. They have creative burgers like the Guacamole with shaved red onion, grilled corn, guacamole, and ranch and the K Pop with mixed greens, kimchi, braised pork belly, and gochujang mayo (gochujang is a type of Korean red chili paste).  The beef comes from La Frieda Meat Purveyors in New Jersey (where Bang Bang's chef/owner Joseph Huang comes from) and the buns come from Dukes Bread in Charlotte.  Along with burgers, you can get snacks and sides like cheeseburger egg rolls ($3.50) and Brussels sprouts ($4), burger bowls ($13-14 each), and sandwiches ($10.50-12.00). Alcohol includes local beers and cider on draft, canned, and bottled ($4-7 per serving).  I tried a couple burgers:  * Sriracha Burger (single patty, $10) - habernero cheese, fried onion strings, shaved jalapenos, and "green Sriracha" * Fried Green Tomato Burger (weekly special, single patty, $11) - avocado ranch, cheddar, fried green tomato, and arugula  And my buddy got the Bang Bang Burger:  * Bang Bang Burger (single patty, $9.50) - American cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles, "Bang sauce"  Both burgers came with a side of hand-cut fries. Everything was presented beautifully on wooden serving boards. Each serving of fries was lined with paper and placed inside a mini fryer basket. The burgers were served open-faced with sauces, such as the green Sriracha, on the side.  As a spicy food lover, I thought the Sriracha Burger could have been much spicier. For me, it was mild in terms of spice. Despite the lack of heat, I still thought the burger was quite tasty. The habanero cheese was thick and rich and the fried onion strings were wispy and delightfully crispy. I'm not really sure what was up with the green Sriracha. Was it housemade or store-bought? I liken it to a spicy mustard. It wasn't bad.  The Fried Green Tomato Burger was great though messy to eat. This burger had a lot of going on with two layers of avocado ranch, a thick slice of fried green tomato, and an almost heaping amount of cheese, not to mention the burger patty itself plus a topping of fresh arugula. This was a very flavorful burger that hit you with a variety of tastes and textures. If it's available during your visit, I recommend it.  As far as the actual burger patties and buns went, I thought they were A-OK. They were good quality, but I wouldn't say they were exceptional or memorable. The patties and buns were standard size with the patties nicely cooked and the buns lightly grilled.  My friend enjoyed his Bang Bang Burger. I have no clue what was in the Bang sauce. It looked like Thousand Island dressing.  Service was terrific. We showed up on a Friday around 1:15pm and the restaurant wasn't busy. We didn't have to wait in line and our orders came out quick. The staff was nice.

I love the double bang bang all the way with brussel sprouts. My wife got the burger bowl with salmon this time and she said it was really good.   My only knock on this place and its a small one is that I wish there were more kids options for sides. My kids are big fans of fries or chips so applesauce would be a nice alternative.

The ingredients are fresh and delicious. Can't quite put my finger on it, but the meat IS better . Looking forward to retrieving soon .

gpfnMrc_JETvSRfcZ4SBBw.text: after driving around 15 minutes trying to find the place we finally did find it. We went in, the whole neighborhood smells like burgers.. yum. it was just like any new restaurant in Charlotte cement floors no ceiling nothing to absorb any sound and we went on the night that kids eat free, you do the math. That however is not their fault. We ordered, the service was quick and friendly, I had a regular burger with an order of fries. They came to the table very quickly I asked for the fries to be cooked krisp and they were and delicious. the guy that brought the food even asked us if there was anything else you could get us. That's kind of rare anymore. The burger was delicious as well but very greasy. as a matter of fact and I'm sure it's because I don't eat a lot of Grease, I had a upset stomach the next morning. But again that's not their fault. Prices were reasonable, I definitely would go again. But not on kids eat free night which by the way is Tuesday night.

T3BO981GTH2RD14qxbecWA.text: I just heard that the bites are gone and burgers are in. I'm a big fan of bang bang burgers and have been to bang bang bites twice. The bites did need some work (cheese just wasn't melting). That said though, I really appreciate that Joe took a risk and tried something new. The concept was fun, staff was friendly, and the pimento bite was awesome. I'm personally looking forward to the TNT burger hopefully coming to south end now, but I hope this doesn't stop Joe from being innovative in the future.

N-5c80xeYfr_3tgCyoMvmA.text: Wife wanted to try this place out before the Checkers game. This was the Saturday after it opened so I will give a pass on some things but overall, I wasn't real impressed. First, things were coming soon-beer(was not happy about this. I really wanted a beer with my sliders) and specials- even though there probably wouldn't have been one on a Saturday. Menu is sort of small, which coincidentally is the same as the sliders. For me, two bites and it was gone. Even my wife was a little disappointed in how small they were. Sliders tasted fine. The fried mac and cheese slider was my favorite. I was a little disappointed with the Sriracha slider as it didn't seem to have a lot of flavor. Sliders come with BBQ chips which were good. I did notice they seem to have these ready to just put on plates which made me worry they have be old but mine were good. Personally, I thought it was overpriced for the amount of food you get. Two sliders was $11, three for $15 and that did not include a drink. We will give it another try maybe after beer is finally being sold.

Hoping they add some draft beers and keep up the impressive business!

WqnPbW_AVBmuELC49aMdKQ.text: Let me start out by emphasizing my stars are more for customer service (5 stars) and speed of service. The staff was very friendly the place was clean. With that being said if I could give the food a separate grade it would be 3 stars. Hence my average rating of 4 stars. Today I had a revelation....I hate grass-fed ground beef! It has this funky taste that I can't put my finger on but for me it sucks! I consider myself a burger connoisseur and I can't believe how bad the grass makes the burger taste! Now I know why I hated the burgers at other Charlotte restaurants. (Dogwood, Porter's House, WholeFoods burger bar (South Park)). The fries were cooked perfectly except had little to no salt on them. My wife enjoyed her black bean burger bowl. As nice as this place is and I know it's popular I will not be returning. My favorite burger in Charlotte is still Bad Daddy's.

lTKzcAp5h03gV7ZEdKURQg.text: I would defiantly agree these might be the best burgers in Charlotte. We got the mushroom soup burger- I know!!! But it was beautiful :) perfectly cooked medium burger with a mushroom soup sauce over top oozing out with every bite. The bun was soft and fresh and fries hand cut happiness. A friend got a more traditional burger and absolutely loved it as well. I cant wait to try the next specialty burger they come up with :)
